scenario_description: Dr. Raj Venkataraman (AGENT2) mission failure analysis scenario. BRANCHING mode simulation of a cascading hardware failure during a crewed lunar gateway mission. At T+72 hours, the primary coolant loop pump fails, triggering thermal cascade across three subsystems. The crew must choose between three response strategies: manual repair (high risk, preserves mission), automated backup activation (moderate risk, degrades capability), or mission abort (low risk, mission loss). Each branch propagates forward with quantitative state tracking for O2 reserves, power budget, thermal balance, and crew fatigue. Knowledge provenance tracks when each crew member becomes aware of anomalous telemetry and how information delays affect decision quality.

branch_a_manual_repair.label: Manual Repair

branch_b_backup_activation.label: Automated Backup
branch_b_backup_activation.description: Activate redundant coolant loop. Moderate risk: backup loop has 60% rated capacity. Degrades mission capability but maintains crew safety margin.

branch_c_abort.label: Mission Abort
branch_c_abort.description: Initiate return trajectory. Low crew risk but total mission loss. Ground control preference.
